To everybody freaking the hell out because of the "dirty hands" of the workers, here are a few points :
- @0:44 you can see on the label "STERILE EO". This means that this is indeed sterile. The "EO" means it's done using ethylene oxide either at high pressure or under vacuum. EO does get through anything (including the packaging). This is done after packaging so everything inside of it is sterile until open.
It can be done with X-rays or UV beams, in which cases it's written R or UV instead.
- Gloves are useless and as dirty as clean hands if you don't use a new sterile pair with each new thread. This would be pointless and expensive.
- To be able to sell this to hospitals, the company must comply to norms, thus the whole plant is checked once in a while and samples tested for germs for every single lot.
- Your body and skin is a lot dirtier than you think and these threads are much much much cleaner than you'd think, even before being sterilized.
